content.description: An excellent addition to upper Emancipation. This mixed line heads up the center of the face, also the rap line for the other two routes on this wall. Crux is at the 3rd and 4th bolts, then a balancy middle with gear placing, and a thin exciting finish. Well protected but trying to trust the smears still makes this one rousing.
content.protection: 10 bolts   Small and medium gear   Bolted anchor
content.location: Starts inbetween Fleming's Hand and Aces High. Then straight up. Climbs over the pine tree. 70m rope minimum.

content.description: Very worthwhile trad climb with a bolt protected crux up high. Take the large dihedral on the left side of this wall. At the large ledge, stay right up the smaller dihedrals. Don't know what this route is actually called, it was forgotten and didn't make it into the new guidebook.
content.protection: 1 bolt   Double rack to BD #2   Nuts, RPs   Long slings   Bolted anchor
content.location: Climb the series of inside corners on the left edge of the wall. 70m rope minimum!

content.description: One of my favorite routes in The Hills! A Ballancy face start leads to a small left facing dihedral. Pull a small roof at the top of the dihedral and traverse right about 10 feet (take care-not protectable-but easy) to gain a beautiful splitter finger to hand to large hand crack! Multiple Cruxes just above the first bolt,at roof of dihedral and midway up the crack.
content.protection: 2 bolts low. then Look for the crystal placement just made for a .5 Camalot! sling your gear at the traverse to avoid rope drag! this route takes amazing gear. One set of stoppers-.3 to #3 Camalots. Doubles 1-3 if you want to sew it up. Bolted Chain Anchors at top left.

content.description: Wanted: Awesome Rock Quality, Amazing Views, & Bomber Gear Placements-this is the place!
